titleStmt.title: Howard McMillen v. O. D. Butterfield. Return from Police Chief

bibl.title: Howard McMillen v. O. D. Butterfield. Return from Police Chief
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

div1.p:
Territory of Washington, County of King. ss.
O. D. Butterfield, being first duly sworn on oath, says; that he is the Chief of Police of the City of Seattle, King County, Washington Territory; that, on to-wit, the 8th. day of May, 1889, he received information from a person in the said City of Seattle, whose name is to affiant unknown, that the said Edward Crofery and Howard Mc.Millan had committed the crime of burglary, at the City of Vancouver, in the Province of British Columbia, and was then and there requested to arrest and hold said parties until the authorities from the said City of Vancouver should call for said persons; that, in pursuance of said request, he arrested the said Howard Mc.Millan and Edward Crofery, and held them until the 11th. day of May, 1889, when the United States martial of the Territory of Washington went to the City jail, in said City of Seattle, and took the said Edward Crofery and Howard Mc.Millan from the jailer of said City by virtue of a warrant issued out of the United States Commissioners' Court, at the City of Seattle, upon the charge of bringing smuggled goods into the United States; that the said Edward Crofery and Howard Mc. Millan are now in the custody and under the control of the said United States martial of Washington Territory, and this affiant is therefore unable to produce them before this honorable Court. That this affiant held said parties for the period of time aforesaid, under and by virtue of two telegrams received from the Chief of Police of the City of Vancouver, British Columbia, which are hereto attached, and made a part of this return. That said prisoner here taken from the said City Jailor before the writ of Habeas Corpus herein was served on this affiant O. D. Butterfield Subscribed and sworn to before me this 11th. day of May, 1889. S. N. Piles Notary Public in and for Wash. Terr. O D Butterfield Chief of police Resworn to before me this 11th day of May 1889, S H Piles. Notary Public
